name: The Hen with the Golden Eggs
description: Esopo wrote a fable entitled The Hen with the Golden Eggs, about a hen that laid a golden egg every day; its owner, being so ambitious, killed it thinking he was going to be a millionaire instantly, because inside he was going to find a treasure, but he discovered that he was the same as all the other hens and consequently lost the abundant fruit that the hen gave him. The flighty behavior of these birds, made the word "hen" to be used as fearful. And in Art it is a symbol of vigilance and activity. For this reason it is found in ancient monuments among the attributes of Minerva, Mercury, Asclepius and many others.
